author: Admin
changes: Admin: units can be selected one by one, even if some have the same short name or name

author: Admin
changes: Dashboard: Show reported disruptions by other teams
General: Buttons in dialogs are aligned
Landing Page: Users are restricted to see groupings of different subdepartments
Production: An attending shift needs to be selected before starting a shift
Admin: Same short names for units to set up a new configuration can be used
Production: The dialog to view a disruption now displays the informationen better.
fixes: Production Unit: Possible to decrease the amount of rejected products.
Production: The disruption dialog is changed so that the dialog's width and the chips' positions do not change unintentionally.
Production: In the dialog for the disruption editing, there is now a space between the dialog's title and the disruption's name.

author: Admin
changes: Security: API endpoints are restricted based on the rights assigned to the respective roles.
Production: Units appears connected in the side navigation bar.
Production: Actual Count calculation has been modified for the units connected to machines.
Shopfloor dashboard: Morning, afternoon and night are now visible.
Shopfloor dashboard: Only show teams that are part of a unit.
fixes: Production: Possible to filter teams in the previous section for the reported disruptions.
Production: Disruption finder now appears in the correct tab.
Shopfloor dashboard: Disruptions are correctly joined to actualcount.
Dashboard: Proper embedding of Quicksight dashboards.

author: Admin
changes: Production: Actual count will be shown.
Production: Get information on the reported disruptions.
Dashboard: NULL value is not shown anymore.
fixes: Production: Disruptions are searchable for previous Teams.
Production: Chips are clickable if category and cause contain the same text.
Team-Monitor: Cycle disruptions do always appear on team monitor.
Dashboard: Previous shift shows always data again.

author: Admin
changes: Dashboard shop floor: new team filter.
Dashboard long-term: m100 number available.
Dashboard: labels and tooltips are now in German.
Production: Autocomplete available for measures in the disruption dialog.
Production: Different filters applied to my team and previous teams.
fixes: Production: QRK templates from older teams are searchable again.
Dashboard long-term: disruptions are shown again on the long-term dashboard.
Dashboard shop floor: Time and duration columns are now correct.
Production: autocomplete of measures works again.
Production: Other Disruption counter filters by the selected team.
Production: When creating templates, Other Disruption titles aren't allowed anymore.
Dashboard: Weeks are correct again for OEE.
Measures: When creating a measure, no more reloads are happening.

author: Admin
fixes: Production: Standard users can now see Reported Disruptions from selected Team.
Production: Disruptions can be now reported at 00:00.

author: Admin
changes: Team Monitor: The current team can see disruptions reported by theirs and by following teams. Additionally you can find the M100 number in the disruption table.
Production: There is now an option to show the details of a reported disruption.
Production: When reporting a disruption and entering measures, there is an autocomplete based on existing measures of the unit.
Dashboard: Issue specification has been added to the dashboard.
fixes: Measure Management: When creating a measure report, the input data is not disappearing anymore.
Dashboard: Wrong column namings for the shop floor dashboard have been adjusted.
Dashboard: The description on the pareto's x-axis matches the one on the tooltip now.
Dashboard: Both, the long term dashboard and shop floor dashboard show all disruptions again.

author: Admin
changes: Production: As a manager or admin, you can now set different disruption template filters for your team and previous teams.
Dashboard: A new dashboard for the shop floor was added.
Admin: If there are available machines, they can now be connected to units in i.Process.

author: Admin
fixes: Now the m100 number is optional.

author: Admin
changes: Production: You can set a status for a disruption.
Production: Adding the M100 number to a disruption is now possible.
Production: The 'all disruption' filter shows only disruption templates that are linked to the team.
Production: Disruption templates for my team and previous teams can now be prioritized.
Production: When creating QRK templates, you have an auto completion for the template description.
fixes: The correct delta is now shown in case the actual counts are 0.
Adding and editing a new measurement works correctly again.
Opening a dialog in the production app does not change the URL anymore.
Admin: When deleting a unit, the linked grouping is now still visible again.
It doesn't happen anymore, that the content of the disruption dialog disappears while creating or editing a disruption.
Team Monitor: Standard users can see all their according teams again in the dropdown.
UI improvements in the production and team monitor app.

author: Admin
fixes: Adding and editing a new measurement does work again.

author: Admin
fixes: All Cycle/Station per team are displayed again in the admin.

author: Admin
changes: Team Monitor: You can navigate, select groupings and only assembly lines units.
Team Monitor: A information message is shown that no shift is started.
Team Monitor: You can select your team in the top bar.
Team Monitor: You see a summary of the shifts status.
Team Monitor: There is one bar chart that shows the top 5 disruptions of the current shift.
Team Monitor: There is another bar chart that shows the top 3 Disruptions of the previous shift.
Team Monitor: There is a table that shows the latest disruptions reported for the selected team.
Team Monitor: Most recent (within the last 5 minutes) disruptions are highlighted by a blinking red dot.
Team Monitor: There is a counter that shows the amount of most recent disruptions.
fixes: Pareto bar labels are now formatted correctly.

author: Admin
fixes: OEE data is now shown.
Performance increases for navigation and search of disruption templates

author: Admin
changes: You can now define teams for Assembly lines in the Admin app.
Teams can be selected for Assembly lines.
QRK are allowed to add a disruption for a previous team in Assembly lines.
Originator can be selected when creating a disruption template for previous teams.
Previous team disruption templates are shown in the Production app.
Originator and Reporter team info are shown when reporting a disruption for previous teams.
Previous team templates show Originator information and a counter with total disruptions.
Search input works for previous team templates
New team monitor card is shown in the Landing page.
Disruption template cards can be edited
fixes: Other disruption counter is fixed.
Pareto lambda timeout is fixed.

author: Admin
changes: You can now select all disruptions in the filter from iProcess production.
Admins and Managers can now prioritise disruption templates.
Photos can be uploaded when reporting disruptions.
Photos can be downloaded when reviewing disruptions.
fixes: OEE data is now shown.

author: Admin
changes: You can now search for disruption templates.
When creating disruption templates, you can also add issue specifications now.
Given you use a disruption template with issue specifications for creating a new disruption, you can select one or more issue specifications.
In the 'report disruption' tab, there is now an info button with hints on how to use the app regarding this specific area.
fixes: Updating units with a lot of Cycle/Station entries is now working smoother.
A validation issue in the context of updating or creating shift models has been fixed.
The Pareto diagram is now showing all data again.

author: Admin
fixes: Duplicated shift models are now set to 'inactive' by default.
An issue regarding the validation of the start and end time in the shift configuration dialog has been fixed.

author: Admin
fixes: Starting of the Night Shift is possible again.

author: Admin
fixes: i.Process works on Zebra Tablets again.

author: Admin
changes: Improve UX for Shift Model form in Admin.
Update reported disruption table in Production.
Change order of columns in the Pareto diagram.
Align logic of counting Actual Counts for Assembly Lines.
Remove dependencies across shifts for the Actual Counts.
Start and reset of a past shift is now possible for the two last shifts.
Add filter for measure report list.
Now possible to add quantities lost in disruption dialog.
The app recognizes your browser language. This should improve 'translator' problems.
News are now divided into changelog of all versions and changelog popup of current version.
Quicker loading of the Pareto diagram.
Quicker calculation of the Shift Output.
Improve app performance for shorter loading time of data.
Cycle/Stations can be ordered in the Unit Dialog.
Measure Reports can now be edited directly from the Dashboard.
fixes: When there are a lot disruptions and templates, they get loaded more reliable.
Users without authorization can not access i.Process apps anymore.
Rejections are no longer shown in two timeslots.
Manufacturer entry can now be removed in the Unit dialog in Admin.
Shift Model form validation is now fixed.
Cycle/stations can now be added again for all units in Admin.
Duplicate shift model is now working as expected.
Winter- and summertime is now corrected in the Dashboard.
Deleting a Unit does no longer affect the product dialog in Admin
The Quota gets now calculated correctly.
In the Disruption dialog, the current time is used. If the user is in a past Timetab, the past time will be used.
The Output gets now calculated correctly.
Starting a shift with an inactive shift model is no longer possible.
Underscores are now allowed in all input fields.
Removing one Cycle/Station in the Unit admin does no longer lead to multiple Cycle/Station deletes.

author: Admin
changes: The rejected and disruption card counter is calculated at shift level instead of the whole day.
fixes: Switching between units no longer results in missing values.
Assembly lines show correct 'actual' piece counts.
New units can be assigned to a product even if already assigned units have been deleted.
The cycle and station filter now takes effect separately per unit.
After updating an unit name, it appears under a new name in the dashboard. Old data is assigned to the new name.

author: Admin
changes: Actual Counts can be reported as range for assembly lines
Actual Counts can be reported through the new tab navigation
Rejects can be viewed, edited and deleted via the new tab 'Quantities'
Within the Dashboard you can see the defective type
The Dashboard can be used with one scrollbar instead of two
fixes: More that 100 cycle/stations can be added within the iProcess Admin
A unit without a name can not be created
Disruptions for a past shift are shown correctly
Measures can be re-prioritised with drag & drop on the tablet as well

author: Admin
changes: The dashboard displays the top 5 faults, each in a Pareto for frequency and frequency.
Top faults can be selected in the Pareto chart and an action report can be generated.
Incidents entered are updated in real time - no need for browser refresh.Â·
fixes: Faults are assigned to the correct shift in the dashboard.

author: Admin
changes: The sidebar for the i.Process production has the possibility to be minimized.
The additional login for the dashboard is no longer required.
The login form has been changed to a slimmer version.
A responsible sub-department can now be defined for a measure.
fixes: Improvements in showing the disruptions between shifts.
Corrected behavour in the sidebar navigation when closing dialogs.

author: Admin
changes: The rejects and iO is now displayed for the current hour.
'Part' has been renamed to 'Product'.
fixes: Rejects are now correctly displayed across hours.
If no image is uploaded in the admin for NiO acquisition, a suitable form (without image) is offered in Production.
Shift type mapping has been corrected and should be displayed correctly in the dashboard for future captures.
OEE values are now displayed in the dashboard for Performance and Quality.

author: Admin
changes: The Dashboard can now group the disruptions based on shift type (e.g. Morning Shift).
i.Process Production now uses start time instead of end time when reporting a disruption.
i.Process Admin is now able to add a shift change after 9 production time slots.
fixes: Now all units are shown in i.Process Admin.

author: Admin
fixes: Counting of rejects and disruptions is now independent of the change of day. A reject or a disruption can now be recorded before midnight, for example, and is still counted in the 'tile' after midnight.
For the assembly line: Shift configurator now calculates the quota of pieces correctly, i.e. with proportional output.
In Admin: In the shift configuration, downtime can no longer be set in non-production times.
Many small improvements in the UI.

author: Admin
fixes: Disruption templates are not visible after you created it
